moves.2. Nf3 e6 3. g3: with this move I announce my intentions to play the KIA vs the sicilian. It is much harder to gain then against the french.
moves.3... d5 4. e5: this move is used in the KIA to cut off the black kingside from blacks pieces.
moves.4... Nc6 5. Bb5: even though I had prepared the fianchetto, plans change....
moves.6... g6: to advance the dragon bishop. My plan: to exchange the dragon bishop and attack the king on the dark squares.
moves.7. d4 c4: now the center is indeed closed. Now to prepare my prey.
moves.8. Bg5 Bg7 9. h3: to reroute the knight Nh2 g4 and then f6.
moves.11. Bxc6 Nxc6 12. Qd2: to keep an eye on b2 for now and also attacking more dark squares.
moves.14. Nf6+: Kh8 would have been possible except for the hanging bishop on d7.
moves.14... Bxf6 15. Bxf6 a4 16. Qh6: all over. It was actually nice to play with a plan for a change.
